summary: Salivary gland cancer is a group of cancers that start in the salivary glands. These glands produce saliva, which helps with digestion and keeps the mouth moist. Salivary gland cancers can occur in any of the salivary glands, but they are most common in the major salivary glands, which are located in and around the mouth and throat.
symptoms: A lump or swelling in or around the jaw, mouth, or throat
Pain in the face, jaw, or ear
Difficulty swallowing or opening the mouth
Numbness or weakness in the face
A change in the taste of food
A sore that does not heal
diagnosis: Imaging tests (e.g., CT scan, MRI, PET scan)
